events.message: The claimant reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection with moderate damage to the front bumper and minor scratches on the side door.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and inclusion of relevant vehicle details.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to handle this auto accident case to ensure quick processing and assistance.
The claimant received official acknowledgment of the claim and was informed about the upcoming steps and needed documentation.
The claims team requested the accident report from authorities, pictures of the vehicle damage, and the claimant’s driving license for verification.
All requested documents, including the official police report and photos showing vehicle damage, were received from the claimant.
Investigation into the collision circumstances and assessment of damages began with an assigned vehicle inspector scheduled for assessment.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and estimated repair costs were finalized following vehicle inspection.
Based on the damage assessment and investigation results, the insurer proposed a settlement offer covering all necessary vehicle repairs.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt communications and professional handling.
The claim was formally approved for payment after confirmation of the claimant’s acceptance of the settlement offer.
The payment covering the full repair amount was processed and transferred to the claimant’s designated bank account without delay.
Following the successful payment and claimant confirmation of repair commencement, the auto accident claim was officially closed.
